main_definition: A group of people working together in an organization or establishment; a collection of individuals employed to perform specific tasks or duties.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A long stick used as a walking aid or for various purposes like support, punishment, or conducting business transactions
meanings_and_examples.example: The elderly man carried his cane to help him walk.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of people employed in an organization or establishment to perform specific tasks or duties
meanings_and_examples.example: The marketing department is composed of a staff of ten members.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A row of seats, typically along the sides of a stage or at an event
meanings_and_examples.example: We sat in the front row of the staff during the concert.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To forcefully remove someone from their position using physical means
meanings_and_examples.example: The dictator ordered his guards to staff him out if he was ever overthrown.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A series of thin rods or bars used for support, decoration, or other purposes
meanings_and_examples.example: The office building had beautifully crafted wooden staffs running along the corridor.
